intro: Tibouchina weddellii, commonly known as the Brazilian violet, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, violet-pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Tibouchina weddellii thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
